required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Safety and Durability of Effect of LUM001 in the Treatment of Cholestatic Liver Disease in Subjects With Alagille Syndrome (ALGS)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Safety and Durability of the Therapeutic Effect of LUM001, an Apical Sodium-Dependent Bile Acid Transporter Inhibitor (ASBTi), in the Treatment of Cholestatic Liver Disease in Pediatric Subjects With Alagille Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this extension study is to determine the long-term safety and tolerability of an investigational treatment (LUM001) in children with ALGS who have completed participation in a core LUM001 treatment protocol. Efficacy will be assessed by evaluating the effect of LUM001 on pruritus, biochemical markers of pruritus, as well as biochemical markers of cholestasis and liver disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs Reported as Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Clinically significant changes in vital signs (body temperature, blood pressure, respiration and pulse) will be assessed from baseline to week 72.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Clinically Significant Changes in Laboratory Parameters Reported as Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Clinically significant changes in laboratory parameters (clinical chemistry, fasting lipid panel and determination of fat-soluble vitamins, bile acids and other cholestasis biochemical markers) will be assessed from baseline to week 72.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the Long-term Efficacy of LUM001 on Serum Bile Acid Levels
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in serum bile acids will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Long term Effect of LUM001 on Pruritus Measured by ItchRO Patient Reported Pruritus Instrument
secondary_outcome.description: The ItchRO will be completed using an electronic diary (eDiary) twice daily (morning and evening). Change from baseline will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Long term effect on xanthomas associated with ALGS as measured by clinician xanthoma scale
secondary_outcome.description: The degree and severity of xanthomatosis will be evaluated for all participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Long term Effect on Biochemical Markers of Cholestasis and Liver Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Blood and urine samples will be taken for clinical laboratory testing. Changes in ALT (alanine aminotransferase), GGT (gamma glutamyltransferase), and total bilirubin will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: Assessment of Alpha-fetoprotein (AFP), a Marker of Hepatocellular Carcinoma
other_outcome.description: Alpha-fetoprotein (AFP), a marker of hepatocellular carcinoma, will be measured every 6 months throughout optional follow-up period.
Palatability will be assessed by the study participant and or caregiver. Assessments over time will be evaluated.

arm_group.description: LUM001 administered orally up to twice each day

intervention.description: Dosing of LUM001 with the objective of achieving optimal control of pruritus at a dose level that is tolerated by the participant and up to a maximum daily dose of 560 micrograms per kilogram (mcg/kg).

criteria.textblock:
Participation for an individual patient is expected to be approximately 72 weeks.
Patients who complete 72 weeks of treatment may be eligible to receive treatment for up to 52 weeks during the follow-up treatment period. Planned participation for each patient enrolled in the optional follow-up treatment study is 128 weeks, inclusive of a 4-week follow-up phone call.
